page.title: 05 THE LEIGH 3
page.content: Today the children go to a junior school in Norton,the next village 4 kilometres south along the A.38. The secondary children go to Chuchdown Comprehensive School near Gloucester. The National School has now been converted into a house and we were invited inside by the owner who gave us lots of information about the school and the village. It had about 30 pupils and 2 teachers,one for infants,one for juniors.The owners wife went to school in it. {AMENITIES} The only shop closed down 25 years ago so people normally shop in Tewkesbury or Gloucester. The postman comes daily and an ice cream man twice a week.There is a postbox and a public telephone. The electricity only arrived after the Second World War in the late 1940's.
